div.p: Structural characterisation of intermetallic compounds and metal hydrides by powder diffraction.

div.head: Oxygen stabilized intermetallic compounds and their hydrides:
div.p: space group lattice parameters [Å] impurities Zr 3 NiO Cmcm a=3.3336(1), b=10.9696(3), c=8.7687(3) Zr 3 NiOH 5.58 Cmcm a=3.5296(4), b=11.380(1), c=9.664(1) ZrNiH 3 , ZrO 2 Ti 4 Ni 2 O 0.3 Fd3m a=11.33005(6) Ti 2 Zr 2 Ni 2 O 0.3 Fd3m a=11.7989(3) Ti 3 ZrNi 2 O 0.3 Fd3m a=11.5494(1) Ti 2 Zr 2 Co 2 O 0.3 Fd3m a=11.76547(8) ZrO 2 κ -phases with composition A 9 B 4 X y (A = Zr, Hf; B = V, Mo, W, Re; X = B, P, S): Compound space group lattice parameters [Å] impurities Zr 9 Mo 4 S P6 3 /mmc a=8.7371(4), c =U1 =U2 -Zr, Mo, ZrMo 2 Zr 9 V 4 S P6 3 /mmc a=8.6380(5), c=8.5668(6) ZrN Zr 9 Mo 4 Fe P6 3 /mmc a=9.0526(2), c=8.9792(4) ZrO 2 , Mo, ZrMo 2 CsMgH x : Pmmn, a=9.9958(1), b=6.13271(6), c=8.57364(9) atom x y z B[Å 2 ] Cs1 1/4 1/4 0.1796(4) 1.83(4) Cs2 0.4737(2) 1/4 0.6645(3) B Cs1 Mg1 1/4 3/4 0.642(2) 1.6(2) Mg2 0.614(1) 1/4 0.077(1) B Mg1 Ternary intermetallic compounds of type AB 5 and their hydrides: Compound space group lattice parameters [Å] impurities LaNi 2 Mn 3 P 6/mmm a=9.2118(2), c=4.1862(1) Mn LaNi 2 Mn 3 H x P 6/mmm a=9.8952(3), c=4.3062(2) LaNi 2 Mn 3 , Mn NdNi 4 Mg F-43m a=7.09874(4) NdNi 3 NdNi 4 MgH x Pmn2 1 a=5.0795(4), b=5.4893(4), c=7.3846(5) NdNi 4 Mg, NdNi 3 Positions of metal atoms in the new compound CsMgH x and in two new hydrides of the compounds of type AB 5 , as determined here, will serve as starting model for determination of the hydrogen(deuterium) positions by neutron diffraction. Phase analysis of samples with nominal composition Gd 2 Fe 17 : Sample main phases lattice parameters [Å] Gd 2 Fe 17 -not annealled GdFe 9.31 (LuFe 9.5 -type, P6 3 /mmc) a=8.4998(1), c=8.3406(1) GdFe 8.62 (PrFe 7 -type, R-3m) a=8.5382(1), c=12.4389(2) Gd 2 Fe 17 -annealled 900º C GdFe 9.00 (TbCu 7 -type, P6/mmm) a=4.9098(1), c=4.1683(1) GdFe 8.80 (PrFe 7 -type, R-3m) a=8.5415(1), c=12.4387(3) Gd 2 Fe 17 -annealled 1050º C GdFe 8.35 (PrFe 7 -type, R-3m) a=8.5428(1), c=12.4358(1) Fe (Im3m) a=2.8673(1)

Structural data of high precision obtained in this experiment will be used in modeling the stability of phases with the above mentioned three structure types, which were observed in the Yb-Fe-Al system during our previous studies.

div.head: Preliminary test of the hydrogen induced anisotropic line broadening in compounds of type AB 2 :
div.p: Compound space group lattice parameters [Å] Ti(Mn,V,Ni) 2 -not cycled and cycled P6 3 /mmc a=4.9429, c=8.0417 Zr(Mn,V,Ni) 2 -not cycled and cycled Fd3m a=7.0613

These preliminary tests show that the anisotropy of the line broadening induced by the hydrogenation is lower than in the hexagonal compounds AB 5 , like LaNi 5 . More systematic experiments are planned to understand the effect.
